data.title: Leadership Team
data.meta_description: View and learn more about the Technologent leadership team.
data.text:
Rod Wright

Executive Vice President, Global Sales and Engineering

As Executive Vice President of Global Sales and Engineering, Rod Wright is responsible for growth initiatives across the globe. In his role, Rod leads the organization to deliver innovative, Edge-to-Edge IT solutions and services to organizations worldwide. With 25 years of leadership in IT, Rod has deep expertise in driving growth as well as building and maintaining strategic executive and partner relationships.

Rod began his career in technology at Sun Microsystems where he was the Global Account Executive for clients such as Texas Instruments and EDS. Prior to Sun Microsystems, Rod spent five years in the Healthcare industry where he was a Sales Director at Sulzer Medica, a medical device company.

Rod received a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology from Texas Christian University, Fort Worth Texas.

Jim Bevis

Chief Operating Officer

Jim Bevis is responsible for Operations including Sales Support, IT Support, NetSuite Operations, Contract Administration, Financial Analysis, and Vendor relations. Jim joined Technologent in 2002, shortly after the business started. Prior to this, he spent 10 years with Merisel and MOCA in Operations and Distribution. Before joining Merisel, he was Vice President and General Manager of an engineering and manufacturing company. Jim brings many years of operational and logistical experience to Technologent. He has a BS from University of Nebraska and a Masters from Pepperdine University.

Marco Mohajer

President

As the President of Technologent, Marco Mohajer is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the company as well as growth initiatives across the globe. In his role, Marco leads the organization to deliver innovative, Edge-to-Edge IT solutions and services to organizations worldwide.

Prior to being promoted to President, Marco was the Executive Vice President and General Manager of Technologent, where he was responsible for running sales and marketing across the globe. With 25 years of leadership in IT, Marco has deep expertise in driving growth as well as building and maintaining strategic executive and partner relationships.

Marco began his career in IT at Netscape/AOL/Time Warner, where he oversaw retail and enterprise channel sales and marketing. When Sun acquired Netscape, Marco assumed leadership roles in Sunâ€™s Americas Software Channel Organization. Prior to joining Technologent in 2008, Marco spent five years as the Vice President of Field Sales Operations for Avnet Technology Solutions, where he ran a multi-billion-dollar practice.

Marco holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Management Information Systems from California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo.

Tom Gallaway

Founder

Tom Gallaway is an innovative professional with demonstrated initiative and creativity in various technology startups and established companies. Tom has extensive knowledge and prior success in mergers and acquisitions, organizational structure, and development of go-to-market plans and solution deliverables, all focused on achieving very rapid organic growth.

Under his leadership, Technologent has an established global presence. Prior to founding Technologent, Tom was the President of Webharbor. Before joining Webharbor, Tom spent five years with Merisel as the Director of Strategic Partnership / MOCA where he managed the Complementary Products Group and sold products that complemented SUN hardware sales to resellers throughout North America.

Tammy Cooper

CEO, CFO & Chairman

As CEO/CFO/Chairman, Tammy is responsible for the oversight and management of all departments of Technologent including its sales, finance, personnel, legal, corporate and governance functions.

Prior to her promotion to CEO and Chairman, Tammy functioned as the CFO and VP of Human Resources for Technologent over the past 15 years. Under her guidance, Cooper has driven 25% year over year revenue and GP growth in leading the corporation through its growth phase from an emerging startup to its current standing as an established $500M+ technology integrator recognized throughout the industry for its value added professional services businesses in conjunction with its diverse OEM product portfolio. Cooperâ€™s financial acumen has been key in leading the company through growth during downturns in the economy and economic expansions, efficient audit controls, strategic cash flow management, banking relationships, strategic planning and needed credit line financing to spur growth and critical investments.

Cooper is also responsible for hiring, implementing and managing all Technologent personnel. Under her leadership, the company has grown from under 50 employees to its current 300 employee workforce deployed throughout its key offices in Irvine, Phoenix, Las Vegas, Denver, Dallas, New York, Nashville and Austin. Processes she implemented in her Human Resource role for recruiting, maintaining regulatory compliance, performance reviews, benefit administration and cultivating employee relationships have resulted in the hiring and retention of key strategic personnel while reducing turnover by over 50%. Prior to joining Technologent, Tammy worked for a national family owned steel company for 17 years managing their HR and finance functions. During her successful career she has won numerous awards for leadership.

Tammy holds a BBA in Accounting from Cleveland State University, Cleveland, Ohio.

James Kuan

General Counsel

James manages the legal function at Technologent to partner with and enable its aggressive growth strategies in cloud, security, datacenter, managed services, gaming and professional services while remaining compliant with all legal parameters that govern our operations. This includes the negotiation of all customer, software licensing, hardware sales, vendor, partner, OEM, professional services and maintenance agreements as well as litigation management, equity/debt financing, IP protection and development, employment/HR, M&A, compliance, privacy and corporate governance.

Prior to Technologent, James served as general counsel at VC backed Greenwave Systems (a leading SaaS based IOT software platform), associate general counsel with Altisource f/n/a Equator (a leading SaaS based operations firm servicing 7 of the 10 largest financial institutions worldwide), and senior counsel with TRIATEK (building automation controls supplier sold to Johnson Controls). His leadership has been instrumental in adroitly leading a number of companies through strategic exits, acquisitions and expansion.

James attended the University of Washington in Seattle, WA for both of his undergraduate and law degrees, has 3 energetic children he is raising with his wife, Doris, and enjoys volunteering his time as a church youth group board member, varsity basketball coach and high school speech and debate teacher.
